definitions.definition: the life story of a saint ( such stories are often embellished , but any kind is called a legend )
examples: As a child she had nothing to read but the legends of early Christian martyrs.

definitions.definition: An unrealistic story depicting past events.

subdefinitions.definition: A story of unknown origin describing plausible but extraordinary past events .
examples: The legend of Troy was discovered to have a historical basis.

subdefinitions.definition: A plausible story set in the historical past, but whose historicity is uncertain.
A story in which a kernel of truth is embellished to an unlikely degree.
examples: The 1984 Rose Bowl prank has spawned many legends . Here's the real story.

subdefinitions.definition: A fabricated backstory for a spy , with associated documents and records.
examples: According to his legend , he once worked for the Red Cross, spreading humanitarian aid in Africa.

definitions.definition: A person related to a legend or legends.

subdefinitions.definition: A leading protagonist in a historical legend.
examples: Achilles is a legend in Greek culture.

subdefinitions.definition: A person of extraordinary fame or accomplishments . ( UK , Ireland , Australia , New Zealand , colloquial , slang ) A cool, nice or helpful person, especially one who is male.
examples: Michael Jordan stands as a legend in basketball.
I've lost my pen! —Here mate, borrow mine. —You legend .

definitions.definition: A key to the symbols and color codes on a map , chart , etc.
examples: According to the legend on the map, that building is a school.

definitions.definition: An inscription , motto , or title, especially one surrounding the field in a medal or coin, or placed upon a heraldic shield or beneath an engraving or illustration.
A musical composition set to a poetical story.
The design and specification of a vessel.

main_definition: the life story of a saint ( such stories are often embellished , but any kind is called a legend )
secondary_definitions: An unrealistic story depicting past events.
A person related to a legend or legends.
( cartography ) A key to the symbols and color codes on a map , chart , etc.
( numismatics , heraldry ) An inscription , motto , or title, especially one surrounding the field in a medal or coin, or placed upon a heraldic shield or beneath an engraving or illustration.
A musical composition set to a poetical story.
( naval ) The design and specification of a vessel.
